title: Amendment to Reciprocal Tariffs and Updated Duties as Applied to Low-Value Imports From the People's Republic of China
summary:
The document outlines Executive Order 14259, issued on April 8, 2025, which amends reciprocal tariffs and updates duties on low-value imports from the People's Republic of China (PRC). This action arises from a national emergency declared due to significant U.S. goods trade deficits. In response to the PRC's imposition of a 34% tariff on U.S. goods, the U.S. will increase certain tariffs to 84% on affected imports, effective April 9, 2025. The order also raises the ad valorem duty from 30% to 90% and adjusts postal item duties.

Key implications include heightened trade tensions between the U.S. and PRC, potential retaliatory measures, and impacts on U.S. businesses and consumers reliant on imports. The order emphasizes the government's commitment to addressing trade imbalances and protecting national security. Implementation will involve collaboration among various government departments to ensure compliance and effectiveness of the order.
